comments:
Occurs very often in my workspace. It may be related to the fact that my deployed project is often not updated when source changes...

Tested with Eclipse 3.2RC7 and WTP-1.5RC4.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jst.common.jdt.internal.classpath.FlexibleProjectContainer.computeClasspathEntries(FlexibleProjectContainer.java:170)
	at org.eclipse.jst.common.jdt.internal.classpath.FlexibleProjectContainer.isOutOfDate(FlexibleProjectContainer.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.jst.common.jdt.internal.classpath.FlexibleProjectContainer$Listener.resourceChanged(FlexibleProjectContainer.java:408)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:274)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.broadcastPostChange(Workspace.java:256)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation(Workspace.java:958)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1746)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.model.Breakpoint.setAttributes(Breakpoint.java:234)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.model.Breakpoint.setPersisted(Breakpoint.java:145)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.JavaDebugOptionsManager$InitJob.run(JavaDebugOptionsManager.java:145)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Incorrect component given the stack trace, but there is no jst.common. Moving to jst.j2ee, which I assume owns this code.

I believe that at least one of your projects is corrupted. ComponentCore.createComponent() is returning null. I will add the null check and make the classpath container no-ops when this situation is detected.

If you know how you got in this state, let us know. If you don't and restarting Eclipse does not cure this, then could you share your project metadata? We don't need any of your source, just the contents of the .settings directory and the .classpath and .project files for each project in your workspace.

Created an attachment (id=43639)
Patch

The patch adds a simple null check to gracefully deal with this situation. It is still unknown how this situation is produced.

I don't know how the workspace got in this state; all I have noticed is that the whole WTP framework wrt publishing is very fragile.
I have copied all of the metadata for my projects including the .metadata directory; since the result is too big to post you can download this file from http://etc.to/tmp/eclipse-state.tgz

Chuck, 

Could you take a look into why ComponentCore.createComponent() might be returning null. I didn't see anything obvious in the attached metadata, but it's a large workspace and I could have missed something. One thing I noticed is that it has a mixture of .component and org.eclipse.wst.common.component files. I don't know if that would cause any problems or is benign.
I will download the file now....   a few reasons could cause this issue including missing facet nature, corrupted .component file etc....
+1 for WTP 1.5 RC5. Simple guard added.
